alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Franklin; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Tensas, northern Catahoula and southern Franklin Parishes through 615 PM CDT... At 515 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wallace Ridge, or 20 miles northwest of Ferriday, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Enterprise around 520 PM CDT. Wisner and Jigger around 545 PM CDT. Cooter Point around 555 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Harrisonburg, Gilbert and Sicily Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana.
